info.title: Elorus Developer API
info.description:
The Elorus developer API enables external applications access the [Elorus 
platform](https://www.elorus.com) and update organization data 
programmatically. For example, you may use the API to:

- Update your data without interacting with the Elorus user interface
- Connect your e-shop / website, automate the invoicing process and 
synchronize data
- Use Elorus as your billing system

This portal provides documentation for developers to access and 
use the Elorus API.

tags.name: Authorization
tags.description:
**Organizations** are a key concept in Elorus. Each user is assigned a role 
within an organization / company, depending on which he may or may not 
be able to perform actions. To specify the organization on which you 
wish to operate, you must provide the custom 
`X-Elorus-Organization` HTTP header:

    X-Elorus-Organization: 128759403567807

Since each API key represents a user, the ability to retrieve, update or 
delete data **depends on the user role** within the specified organization.

In the event of an unauthorized request, the Elorus API returns a `HTTP 403` 
response. Additional details about the error may be provided within the 
response body.

The use of `X-Elorus-Organization` is explicitly documented where needed,
under the *Header Parameters* section. 

To start developing with the Elorus API you need to sign up for a free account.
The best way to try out Elorus and test your code is through 
[demo organizations](#tag/Using-the-API).

tags.name: Using the API
tags.description:
## Demo organizations

While developing your application, 
it is recommended to restrict all API requests only to demo organizations 
by providing the `X-Elorus-Demo` HTTP header:

    X-Elorus-Demo: true


This way Elorus will enforce a demo organization, preventing accidental data 
loss on production organizations. Demo organizations are a special form of 
organizations, suitable for reviewing 
Elorus and experimenting with the API. Within a demo organization:

- You can create unlimited documents to unlimited clients / suppliers.
- You can only have a single user - yourself.
- User management & plan subscription functionality is disabled both in 
the application UI and the API.
- Data is automatically reset at the 1st of every month.

****
Demo organizations can be created through the Elorus UI. Contact the [Elorus 
support team](mailto:support@elorus.com) for more information.
****

## Call rate limits

Each user has a hard limit of 1000 API calls per day. 
At the same time, a user may not perform more than 60 requests 
per minute. If an API call exceeds these limits, you will receive an 
`HTTP 429` response. The accompanying error message will look like 
`"Request was throttled. Expected available in 60.0 seconds"`.

## Localization

### Language

The English language is used throughout the Elorus API, regardless 
of the authenticated user's language preference. The English
locale conventions are also used for decimal numbers and dates:

- The character `.` is used as a floating point for decimal numbers.
- Dates are expected & returned in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

### Timezone
The UTC timezone is used throughout the Elorus API. 
Datetime values are formatted in the standard ISO format.

tags.name: contacts
tags.description:
A contact in Elorus represents a client, a supplier or both.  

#### Tracking categories
Contacts may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can be of
great use in reports. The API allows for full
control over contact tracking.

tags.name: invoices
tags.description:
An invoice holds information regarding the actual transaction
(such as the client, date, amounts etc.), as well as additional
information needed to render the document as PDF.


#### Client data
Invoices also keep a copy of all the client information that will
appear on the PDF. As a result you may modify the underlying client
[contact](#tag/contacts) (e.g. update the billing address) 
without affecting the printable form of past transactions with that client.


#### Payment gateways
If you want to let clients pay online, you must associate 
one or more [payment gateways](#tag/paymentgateways) with your invoices.
Each invoice may have a distinct set of payment gateways, depending
on the business needs (e.g. the client's currency or country etc.)  


#### Tracking categories
Invoices may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your sales performance. The API allows for full
control over the invoice tracking.

tags.name: creditnotes
tags.description:
A credit note holds information regarding the actual transaction
(such as the client, date, amounts etc.), as well as additional
information needed to render the document as PDF.

#### Client data
Credit notes also keep a copy of all the client information that will
appear on the PDF. As a result you may modify the underlying client
[contact](#tag/contacts) (e.g. update the billing address) 
without affecting the printable form of past transactions with that client.

#### Tracking categories
Credit notes may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your sales performance. The API allows for full
control over the credit note tracking.

tags.name: estimates
tags.description:
An estimate holds information regarding the actual offer
(such as the client, date, amounts etc.), as well as additional
information needed to render the document as PDF.

#### PDF rendering
The entity responsible for rendering credit notes to PDF is called
[Template](#tag/templates). Templates dictate the design (such as
the layout, color schemes, logo etc) as well as the contents
of the PDF (language, which columns to show / hide on each line etc.).

#### Client data
Estimates also keep a copy of all the client information that will
appear on the PDF. As a result you may modify the underlying client
[contact](#tag/contacts) (e.g. update the client address) 
without affecting the printable form of past transactions with that client.

#### Accepted / rejected estimates
Whenever an estimate is sent to the client, they are able to accept or
reject the quote. This information is stored on the `accept_status` field.
The API also allows you to programmatically mark the estimate as 
accepted or rejected, by modifying the `accept_status` field.

tags.name: recurringinvoices
tags.description:
Recurring invoices serve as a template, based on which
new invoices are created automatically. The frequency 
that new invoices are generated 
is determined by a corresponding *schedule*.

#### Recurring schedule
The recurring schedule comprises four fields. The `start_datetime`
denotes the first time that a new invoice should be created. The
`interval` and `period` fields specify the frequency 
(e.g. every 2 weeks) and the `end_datetime` the date on which the
last execution will occur. For example, to create a recurring invoice
that will start on Jan 1, 2019 and will generate new invoices
every month until Jan 1, 2020, the recurring schedule would be:

~~~
start_datetime   2019-01-01T10:00:00.0Z
interval         1
period           months
end_datetime     2020-01-01T10:00:00.0Z
~~~

#### Generated invoices
Additional information regarding the generated invoices 
(i.e. the client, invoice lines, appearance settings etc.) is also
stored on the recurring invoice. Therefore, recurring invoices
have most of their fields in common with 
[normal invoices](#tag/invoices). For example, the recurring invoice's
`draft` field controls whether the created invoice will be a draft,
rather than whether the recurring invoice itself is a draft. 
To easily identify the role of each field, please see the field
description in the corresponding endpoints.


#### Tracking categories
Recurring invoices can also hold information about your 
[custom tags](#tag/trackingcategories). Once again, this 
does not categorize the recurring invoice; it dictates
the tags that will be automatically assigned to the created
invoices instead.

tags.name: bills
tags.description:
Bills typically represent invoices that you receive from 
suppliers. 

#### Bill lines
Elorus allows you to record every line of the
received invoice separately. If you do not care about the
details, you may choose to store total amounts in a single line.


#### Self-billing
Self-billing is a commercial arrangement between a supplier and a 
customer in which the customer (you) prepares the supplier's invoice 
and forwards a copy to the supplier with the payment. In Elorus, self-billed
invoices comprise a special form of bills that can be exported to a PDF, 
and must be therefore associated with a [document type](#tag/documenttypes).
To denote a self-billed invoice, the `self_billed` flag must be used.

#### Tracking categories
Bills may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your bills. The API allows for full
control over the bill tracking.

tags.name: suppliercredits
tags.description:
Supplier credits typically represent credit notes that you receive from 
suppliers. 

#### Supplier credit lines
Elorus allows you to record every line of the
received credit note separately. If you do not care about the
details, you may choose to store total amounts in a single line.


#### Tracking categories
Supplier credits may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your purchases. The API allows for full
control over the supplier credit tracking.

tags.name: expenses
tags.description:
Expenses typically represent already paid bills. Expenses may optionally
be associated with a supplier.

#### Expense lines
Elorus allows you to record every expense line separately. 
If you do not care about the details, you may choose to store
total amounts in a single line.


#### Tracking categories
Expenses may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your purchases. The API allows for full
control over the expense tracking.

tags.name: projects
tags.description:
Projects are a set of activities that lead to an agreed outcome. 
There may be one or more teammates assigned to each project, 
bound to devote their time in accomplishing different tasks.

Elorus helps you track time spent, calculate labor costs as well 
as other expenses you may have added. At the same time, rates per 
hour allow you to seamlessly invoice your clients while you can 
check how much you have spent and what you are about to make at 
any given time.

tags.name: cashreceipts
tags.description:
Payments received represent money that you receive in the context
of a single transaction. They can be either a client payment,
a supplier refund, other income or other payments (for more information, 
please see the Elorus documentation).

#### Tracking categories
Payments received may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your cash flow. The API allows for full
control over the payments received tracking.

tags.name: cashpayments
tags.description:
Payments sent represent money that you sent in the context
of a single transaction. They can be either a supplier payment,
a client refund or other payments (for more information,
please see the Elorus documentation).

#### Tracking categories
Payments sent may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and can help you
better understand your cash flow. The API allows for full
control over the payments sent tracking.

tags.name: products
tags.description:
This entity represents inventory items that 
your company may sell or purchase. Products / services may be
assigned to invoices, credit notes etc. and are primarily 
used to:

- View sales / purchase reports per item
- Manage inventory stock


#### Products / services in sales & purchases

In real world, products may be sold, purchased or both. 
In Elorus, you must explicitly specify whether you buy or 
sell a product: 

To be able to associate a product with an invoice or 
credit note, the product's
`sales` property must be set to `true`. 
To be able to associate a product with a bill or 
a supplier credit, the product's
`purchases` property must be set to `true`  


#### Stock management

To let keep track of the product's stock in your inventory, 
the `manage` property must be set to `true`. 
Each time the product is being sold 
(i.e. an invoice line is associated with the product) 
the stock will increase as dictated by the quantity. Each time
the product is being purchased (i.e. associated with a bill)
the stock will decrease as dictated by the quantity.

#### Tracking categories
Products / services may be assigned custom tags. Tags are grouped under
[custom categories](#tag/trackingcategories) and are primarily a reporting
tool: they can help you better understand your sales / purchases.

tags.name: taxes
tags.description:
You may retrieve the list of taxes via the API. However,
to update or create new records, the web application must be used.

tags.name: paymentgateways
tags.description:
You may retrieve the list of payment gateways via the API. However,
to update or create new records, the web application must be used.

tags.name: expensecategories
tags.description:
Expense categories enable users to classify expenses & bills. Elorus
comes with a predefined set of expense categories. Users may also
create additional, custom categories.

tags.name: trackingcategories
tags.description:
Tracking categories are primarily a reporting tool to help you
monitor the performance of all sorts of records. Think of each category
as a group of conceptually related, mutually exclusive options (tags) that
can be used to identify a record.

For example, to monitor your sales by continent, you may create a
tracking category named "Continent". The available options will be
"North America", "South America", "Europe", "Asia", "Africa", 
"Australia" and "Antarctica". Once the category is created, 
you may associate each invoice with exactly one continent.

Tracking categories can be used as filters in reports (e.g. you can filter
the results by continent), or even as groupers (e.g. you may view
your revenues per continent and calculate sub-totals).

tags.name: templates
tags.description:
Templates dictate the way that invoices, estimates, credit notes etc. will
be rendered. They hold information about the content (e.g. which columns 
to show on the line items table, whether to display the outstanding amount 
or not, etc.) and the design (e.g. colors, fonts, static texts). 
Templates may also be used to specify default messages that will
be used when communicating with your clients via email.

Each template is associated with a language. You may use multiple templates
to address international clients and issue invoices in different languages.

#### IMPORTANT NOTE

Using this API you are able to obtain the templates and inspect their
properties. However, creating, modifying & deleting templates 
is not supported.

tags.name: emailtemplates
tags.description:
The Email templates are email message presets that can be used whenever
sending an invoice, credit note etc. to a client. 
They utilize a set of predefined variables that can be 
substituted with actual invoice data upon request.

Once an email template has been created, you may use the `email` endpoint
of the corresponding entity 
(e.g. [email an invoice](#operation/invoices_email_read)) 
to retrieve the generated email message.

tags.name: documenttypes
tags.description:
Document types define distinct kinds of documents, each following a separate
numbering sequence. The most common document type is the "Invoice". If, 
for example, one needs to issue "Tax invoices" and "Retail invoices" 
separately, they would create two new document types.

Each document type applies to a specific type of records. You may create 
document types that apply to invoices, credit notes or estimates.

Finally, document types specify the translations to use when invoicing
in multiple languages.

tags.name: numberingsequence
tags.description:
Numbering sequences are prefixes that define a new, unique numbering for
invoices, credit notes, estimates etc. For example, given an
invoicing sequence "A" and a second sequence "B", your invoices may look
like:
- Invoice A-1
- Invoice A-2
- Invoice A-3
- Invoice B-1
- Invoice B-2
- ...

Sequences are always associated with a [document type](#tag/documenttypes),
which in turn applies to either invoices, credit notes, recurring invoices
or estimates.

tags.name: incomesequences
tags.description:
Income sequences are prefixes that define a new, unique numbering for
income transactions - i.e. "Payments received" records, the transaction 
type of which is set to "Income"-. 

There are two kinds of income sequences:
- "Rental income" sequences, that apply exclusively to rental income
- "Contract income" sequences, that apply to any other income record

tags.name: cashreceiptsequences
tags.description:
Accommodation tax sequences are prefixes that define a new, unique 
numbering for accommodation tax transactions - i.e. "Accommodation tax" 
records, the transaction type of which is set to "Accommodation tax"-.

get.description:
Get the list of bills.
---
The response does not include all the bill details.
To retrieve more information about a specific bill, use
the [single bill](#operation/bills_list) endpoint.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results. A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `date`, `supplier__display_name`, `total`, `initial`, `net`, `draft`, `paid`, `payable`, `due_date`, `modified`, `created`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-date`).

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `supplier__display_name`, `supplier__vat_number`, `documenttype__title`, `sequence__name`, `reference`, `items__product__title`, `items__product__code`, `items__description`, `related_notes__notes`, `custom_id`.

parameters.name: period_from
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Must be used with the `period_to` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: period_to
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Must be used with the `period_from` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Optionally filter by the document's status.  The available choices are: `draft`, `issued`, `partial`, `unpaid`, `overdue`, `paid`, `void`.

parameters.name: draft
parameters.description: Optionally filter by draft status. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: fpaid
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the invoice is paid or not. The available choices are: `yes`, `no`.

parameters.name: is_void
parameters.description: Optionally filter by void status.  The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: overdue
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the invoice is overdue or not. The available choices are: `yes`, `no`.

parameters.name: supplier
parameters.description: Optionally filter by supplier ID.

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: Optionally filter by currency code.

parameters.name: documenttype
parameters.description: Optionally filter by document type ID.

parameters.name: self_billed
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the document is self-billed or not. Can be either `1` or `0`. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: Optionally filter by the numbering sequence.

parameters.name: custom_id
parameters.description: Optionally filter by custom ID.

parameters.name: tc_<trackingcategory_id>
parameters.description: Optionally filter by any applied tracking category. The filter's name is parameterized using the tracking category's id. The filter's value can be any of the category's options. For example `?tc_12345=test` means that all records which have been tracked as `test` using `12345` category, will be returned.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: modified_after
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: modified_before
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page. Default is 100.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

post.description:
Create a new bill.
---
To create a new bill, you must first specify the supplier.
If you do not specify the currency code, the supplier's
default currency will have a higher priority than your base currency.

#### Bill lines & amounts
The bill's initial, net and total amount will be calculated
automatically and their values will depend on the calculator
mode and the line items.

When it comes to the bill lines, you may associate each
line with an [inventory product](#tag/products). In this case you can
omit the `description`, `measurement unit` and `value` fields
to have them copied over form product record.
Once again, if you choose to explicitly specify any of these fields,
you end up overriding the default values of the product record.

Remember that if you do not care about the bill details,
you can always just send the total amounts in a single line.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

400.description: Bad request. The exact error message is sent in the response body.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

get.description:
Get a single bill.
---
Returns all available information for a specific bill.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

put.description:
Update a bill.
---
You must send all required fields for the record to be
successfully updated. You may only modify draft bills. To
update issued bills, you should first mark them as draft
via the [partial update endpoint](#operation/bills_partial_update).

To update the line items, the endpoint expects that you send
a complete list of the new items. For existing lines
you must send over their IDs (as returned by the
[retrieve endpoint](#operation/bills_read))
along with any possible changes. If there exist any lines whose
IDs are not sent, they will be deleted. Accordingly, lines for which
you send no ID will result in creating new items.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

400.description: Bad request. The exact error message is sent in the response body.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

delete.description:
Delete a bill.
---
Note that you cannot delete bills marked as issued
(i.e. the `draft` field is set to `false`).

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

patch.description:
Partially update a bill.
---
Since this method does not modify the line items
and amounts you can always use it regardless the bill status.
On the other hand, the
[full update action](#operation/bills_update) is only applicable
to draft bills.

Please note that you cannot mark void bills as draft, unless
you [un-void](#operation/bills_mark_void) them first.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

400.description: Bad request. The exact error message is sent in the response body.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

get.description:
Get the document as PDF.
---
Only self-billed invoices will be printed out to PDF.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

put.description:
Mark the document as void or convert it from void back to issued.

Notice that when you mark a document as void:

* It must already be issued.
* It remains in the system for future reference, but is not involved in Elorus reports.
* The sign "Void" appears for both the document entry inside the system and the printable version of it.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data. Note that the header's value is not important.

400.description: Bad request. The exact error message is sent in the response body.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

get.description:
Get the list of payments sent.
---

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results. A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `date`, `amount`, `contact__display_name`, `modified`, `created`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-date`).

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields

parameters.name: period_from

parameters.name: period_to

parameters.name: purchase

parameters.name: creditnote

The filter's value can be any of the category's options. For example `?tc_12345=test` means that all records which have been tracked as `test` using `12345` category, will be returned.

post.description:
Create a new payment sent.
---
Whenever you transfer money to suppliers or clients, for example a regular supplier expense,
you can create a “Payment sent” record to represent the transaction. Sent payments are
divided into three types:

* Supplier Payment
* Client Refund
* Other payment

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization

post.description:
Create a new credit note.
---
To create a new credit note, you must first specify the client.
You may choose to omit all client-related fields
except from the client ID. In this case, the fields will be initialized
with values originating from the client's contact record.
For example, if you do not specify the `client_email` parameter
it will be automatically copied from the specified contact record.
If you provide blank values (e.g. in case you *do send* the
`client_email` parameter with an empty string value),
the corresponding fields will be left empty.

#### PDF rendering
As far as the PDF rendering is concerned, you must first specify
the template to use. You may override `terms` and `public_notes`
template settings through their separate fields.

#### Credit note lines & amounts
The credit note's initial, net and total amount will be calculated
automatically and their values will depend on the calculator
mode and the line items.

When it comes to the credit note lines, you may associate each
line with an [inventory product](#tag/products). In this case you can
omit the `title`, `description`, `measurement unit` and `value` fields
to have them copied over form product record.
Once again, if you choose to explicitly specify any of these fields,
you end up overriding the default values of the product record.

put.description:
Update a credit note.
---
You must send all required fields for the record to be
successfully updated. You may only modify draft credit notes. To
update issued creditnotes, you should first mark them as draft via the
[partial update endpoint](#operation/creditnotes_partial_update).

When changing the credit note client, all client fields will be updated
based on the new contact record, unless you explicitly
specify their values.

To update the line items, the endpoint expects that you send
a complete list of the new items. For existing lines
you must send over their IDs (as returned by the
[retrieve endpoint](#operation/creditnotes_read))
along with any possible changes. If there exist any lines whose
IDs are not sent, they will be deleted. Accordingly, lines for which
you send no ID will result in creating new items.

post.description:
Create a new estimate.
---
To create a new estimate, you must first specify the client.
You may choose to omit all client-related fields
except from the client ID. In this case, the fields will be initialized
with values originating from the client's contact record.
For example, if you do not specify the `client_email` parameter
it will be automatically copied from the specified contact record.
If you provide blank values (e.g. in case you *do send* the
`client_email` parameter with an empty string value),
the corresponding fields will be left empty.

#### PDF rendering
You may specify the template to use when rendering the estimate to PDF.
If you omit the `template` field, the client's default template will
be used.

#### Invoice lines & amounts
The estimate's initial, net and total amount will be calculated
automatically and their values will depend on the calculator
mode and the line items.

When it comes to the estimate lines, you may associate each
line with an [inventory product](#tag/products). In this case you can
omit the `title`, `description`, `measurement unit` and `value` fields
to have them copied over form product record.

put.description:
Update an estimate.
---
You must send all required fields for the record to be
successfully updated. You may only modify draft estimates. To
update issued estimates, you should first mark them as draft
via the [partial update endpoint](#operation/estimates_partial_update).

When changing the estimate client, all client fields will be updated
based on the new contact record, unless you explicitly
specify their values.

To update the line items, the endpoint expects that you send
a complete list of the new items. For existing lines
you must send over their IDs (as returned by the
[retrieve endpoint](#operation/estimates_read))
along with any possible changes. If there exist any lines whose
IDs are not sent, they will be deleted. Accordingly, lines for which
you send no ID will result in creating new items.

to draft estimates.

post.description:
Create a new invoice.
---
To create a new invoice, you must first specify the client.
You may choose to omit all client-related fields
except from the client ID. In this case, the fields will be initialized
with values originating from the client's contact record.
For example, if you do not specify the `client_email` parameter
it will be automatically copied from the specified contact record.
If you provide blank values (e.g. in case you *do send* the
`client_email` parameter with an empty string value),
the corresponding fields will be left empty.

#### PDF rendering
You may specify the template to use when rendering the invoice to PDF.
If you omit the `template` field, the client's default template will
be used.

#### Invoice lines & amounts
The invoice's initial, net and total amount will be calculated
automatically and their values will depend on the calculator
mode and the line items.

When it comes to the invoice lines, you may associate each
line with an [inventory product](#tag/products). In this case you can
omit the `title`, `description`, `measurement unit` and `value` fields
to have them copied over form product record.

#### Payment gateways
When you create a new invoice, it will be automatically associated
with the default [payment gateways](#tag/paymentgateways) of the
organization (if any), so that the invoice can be paid online.
To modify the invoice's payment gateways, you must use
the [partial update endpoint](#operation/invoices_partial_update).

parameters.name: skip_mydata
parameters.description: Available only when myDATA integration is enabled. Denotes if the document should be *submitted to myDATA upon save*. Use `1` to skip the submission (the user should then manually submit the document when convenient). Using `0`, or omitting the parameter, will result in Elorus attempting to upload the document to myDATA, in real time.

put.description:
Update an invoice.
---
You must send all required fields for the record to be
successfully updated. You may only modify draft invoices. To
update issued invoices, you should first mark them as draft
via the [partial update endpoint](#operation/invoices_partial_update).

When changing the invoice client, all client fields will be updated
based on the new contact record, unless you explicitly
specify their values.

To update the line items, the endpoint expects that you send
a complete list of the new items. For existing lines
you must send over their IDs (as returned by the
[retrieve endpoint](#operation/invoices_read))
along with any possible changes. If there exist any lines whose
IDs are not sent, they will be deleted. Accordingly, lines for which
you send no ID will result in creating new items.

patch.description:
Partially update an invoice.
---
Use this action to update the invoice payment gateways, tracking,
or change it's draft status. Since this method does
not modify the invoice items and amounts you can always use it
regardless the invoice status. On the other hand, the
[full update action](#operation/invoices_update) is only applicable
to draft invoices.

Please note that you cannot mark void invoices as draft, unless
you [un-void](#operation/invoices_mark_void) them first.

get.description:
Get the list of supplier credits.
---
The response does not include all the supplier credit details.
To retrieve more information about a specific record, use the
[single supplier credit](#operation/suppliercredits_read)
endpoint.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results. A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `date`, `supplier__display_name`, `total`, `initial`, `net`, `draft`, `paid`, `payable`, `modified`, `created`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-date`).

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `supplier__display_name`, `supplier__vat_number`, `documenttype__title`, `sequence__name`, `reference`, `items__product__title`, `items__product__code`, `items__description`, `related_notes__notes`, `custom_id`.

parameters.name: period_from
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Must be used with the `period_to` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: period_to
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Must be used with the `period_from` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Optionally filter by the document's status.  The available choices are: `draft`, `issued`, `partial`, `unpaid`, `paid`, `void`.

parameters.name: draft
parameters.description: Optionally filter by draft status. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: fpaid
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the invoice is paid or not. The available choices are: `yes`, `no`.

parameters.name: is_void
parameters.description: Optionally filter by void status.  The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: supplier
parameters.description: Optionally filter by supplier ID.

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: Optionally filter by currency code.

parameters.name: documenttype
parameters.description: Optionally filter by document type ID.

parameters.name: self_billed
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the document is self-billed or not. Can be either `1` or `0`. The available choices are: `1`, `0`.

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: Optionally filter by the numbering sequence.

parameters.name: custom_id
parameters.description: Optionally filter by custom ID.

parameters.name: tc_<trackingcategory_id>
parameters.description: Optionally filter by any applied tracking category. The filter's name is parameterized using the tracking category's id. The filter's value can be any of the category's options. For example `?tc_12345=test` means that all records which have been tracked as `test` using `12345` category, will be returned.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: modified_after
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: modified_before
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards. Date must be in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd` or ISO-formatted.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page. Default is 100.

status.title: Status
status.description:
Automatically generated status. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
draftDraft
issuedIssued
partialPartially paid
paidPaid
voidVoid
overdueOverdue

draft.title: Draft
draft.description: If `true` the document is considered to be a work in progress.

self_billed.title: Self-billed invoice
self_billed.description: Denotes whether this is a self-billed invoice. This value is auto-generated and depends on the bill's document type.

documenttype.title: Document type
documenttype.description: Optionally, associate the record with a document type to denote the type of the received document. This field is required in case of a self-billed document.

sequence.title: Sequence
sequence.description: ID of the associated numbering sequence.

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: A reference code. Usually, the document number as specified by the supplier.

date.title: Date
date.description: The issue date. Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

due_date.title: Due to
due_date.description: Expected payment date. Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

currency_code.title: Currency
currency_code.description:

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

mydata_document_type.title: MyDATA document type
mydata_document_type.description:
Available only when myDATA integration is enabled. One of the following or blank (empty string):
List of values
ValueDescription
1.1Sales Invoice
2.1Service Rendered Invoice
3.1Proof of Expenditure (non-liable Issuer)

mydata_uid.title: UID
mydata_uid.description: Available only when myDATA integration is enabled.

mydata_latest_mark.title: Mydata latest mark
mydata_latest_mark.description: Unique submission ID from myDATA that indicates this document has been submitted.

mydata_latest_cancel_mark.title: Mydata latest cancel mark
mydata_latest_cancel_mark.description: If the latest submission has been canceled, this is the cancellation ID.

mydata_submission_status.title: Mydata submission status
mydata_submission_status.description:
Document status in relation to myDATA. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
sentsent
not_applicablenot_applicable
wont_sendwont_send

branch_code.title: Branch code
branch_code.description: Applies only to organizations based in Greece. When the counterpart has multiple branches, you may specify the branch code to use when uploading this record to myDATA. Leave empty or use '0' to denote the business headquarters.

product.title: Product / Service
product.description: ID of the associated product / service.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 4 decimal places.

unit_measure.title: Measurement unit
unit_measure.description:

unit_value.title: Unit value
unit_value.description: Used in the "initial" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount.title: Unit discount
unit_discount.description: Absolute value, not percentage. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of the applied tax IDs.

items.title: Taxes
items.description: A list of the applied tax IDs.

unit_total.title: Unit total
unit_total.description: Used in the "total" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

item_net.title: Item net value
item_net.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

billable.title: Billable
billable.description: If the line is associated with a project, you may bill the expense to your client the next time you invoice the project.

expense_category.title: Expense category
expense_category.description: ID of the associated expense category.

RecordTrackingCategoryNested.title: Tracking categories

trackingcategory.title: Trackingcategory
trackingcategory.description: ID of the associated tracking category.

option.title: Option
option.description: The selected option of the tracking category.

RecordTrackingCategoryNested.description: An optional list of tracking categories to classify this record.

status.title: Status
status.description:
Automatically generated status. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
draftDraft
issuedIssued
partialPartially paid
paidPaid
voidVoid
overdueOverdue

draft.title: Draft
draft.description: If `true` the document is considered to be a work in progress.

self_billed.title: Self-billed invoice
self_billed.description: Denotes whether this is a self-billed invoice. This value is auto-generated and depends on the bill's document type.

documenttype.title: Document type
documenttype.description: Optionally, associate the record with a document type to denote the type of the received document. This field is required in case of a self-billed document.

mydata_document_type.title: MyDATA document type
mydata_document_type.description:
Available only when myDATA integration is enabled. One of the following or blank (empty string):
List of values
ValueDescription
1.1Sales Invoice
2.1Service Rendered Invoice
3.1Proof of Expenditure (non-liable Issuer)

sequence.title: Sequence
sequence.description: ID of the associated numbering sequence.

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: A reference code. Usually, the document number as specified by the supplier.

date.title: Date
date.description: The issue date. Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

due_days.title: Due days
due_days.description: Days after the issue date, that the invoice will be considered overdue. This affects the document's due date. Use `null` to not set a due date.

supplier_display_name.title: Supplier name
supplier_display_name.description: Applies only to self-billed invoices. The supplier name as it will appear on the PDF.

supplier_profession.title: Supplier profession
supplier_profession.description: Applies only to self-billed invoices. The supplier profession, as it will appear on the PDF.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

items.description: Line items of a bill.

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

withholding_taxes.description: A list of withholding tax IDs to be applied.

items.title: Withholding taxes
items.description: A list of withholding tax IDs to be applied.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

template.title: Template
template.description: Applies only to self-billed invoices. The template to use when rendering to PDF.

public_notes.title: Public notes
public_notes.description: Applies only to self-billed invoices. These notes will appear on the PDF.

trackingcategories.description: An optional list of tracking categories to classify this record.

paid_on_receipt.title: Paid on receipt
paid_on_receipt.description: Available only when myDATA integration is enabled. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payment_method.title: Payment method
payment_method.description:
Available only when myDATA integration is enabled. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
1Domestic Payments Account
2Foreign Payments Account
3Cash
4Cheque
6Web Banking
7POS / e-POS

mydata_uid.title: UID
mydata_uid.description: Available only when myDATA integration is enabled.

mydata_latest_mark.title: Mydata latest mark
mydata_latest_mark.description: Unique submission ID from myDATA that indicates this document has been submitted.

mydata_latest_cancel_mark.title: Mydata latest cancel mark

wont_sendwont_send
not_sentnot_sent

modified.title: Modified on

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

items.description: Line items of a bill.

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

withholding_taxes.description: A list of withholding tax IDs to be applied.

items.title: Withholding taxes
items.description: A list of withholding tax IDs to be applied.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

template.title: Template
template.description: Applies only to self-billed invoices. The template to use when rendering to PDF.

public_notes.title: Public notes
public_notes.description: Applies only to self-billed invoices. These notes will appear on the PDF.

trackingcategories.description: An optional list of tracking categories to classify this record.

paid_on_receipt.title: Paid on receipt
paid_on_receipt.description: Available only when myDATA integration is enabled. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payment_method.title: Payment method
payment_method.description:
Available only when myDATA integration is enabled. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
1Domestic Payments Account
2Foreign Payments Account
3Cash
4Cheque
6Web Banking
7POS / e-POS

mydata_uid.title: UID
mydata_uid.description: Available only when myDATA integration is enabled.

mydata_latest_mark.title: Mydata latest mark
mydata_latest_mark.description: Unique submission ID from myDATA that indicates this document has been submitted.

mydata_latest_cancel_mark.title: Mydata latest cancel mark
mydata_latest_cancel_mark.description: If the latest submission has been canceled, this is the cancellation ID.

mydata_submission_status.title: Mydata submission status
mydata_submission_status.description:
Document status in relation to myDATA. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
sentsent
not_applicablenot_applicable
wont_sendwont_send
not_sentnot_sent

authentication_code.title: Authentication code
authentication_code.description: Hash that verifies that the document is valid.

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

status.title: Status
status.description:
Automatically generated status. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
draftDraft
issuedIssued
partialPartially paid
paidPaid
voidVoid
overdueOverdue

draft.title: Draft
draft.description: If `true` the document is considered to be a work in progress.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

invoice_payments.description: A list of the invoices paid via this transaction. Applies to "Client payment" transactions.

purchasecreditnote_payments.description: A list of the purchase credit notes paid via this transaction. Applies to "Supplier refund" transactions.

ValueDescription

branch_code.title: Branch code
branch_code.description: Applies only to organizations based in Greece. When the counterpart has multiple branches, you may specify the branch code to use when uploading this record to myDATA. Leave empty or use '0' to denote the business headquarters.

IncomeBillingAddress.description: "Rental income" and "Contract income" transactions must by uploaded to the myDATA platform. This field represents the counterpart address, as it will be sent to myDATA.The field is effective only when the myDATA integration is enabled.

transaction_type.title: Transaction type
transaction_type.description:
One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
dpOther payments
ipClient payment
cnpSupplier refund
icmIncome
atAccommodation tax

date.title: Date
date.description: Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

income_type.title: Income type
income_type.description:
Applies only to "Income" transactions. One of the following or blank (empty string):
List of values
ValueDescription
contractContract income
rentalRental income
other_incomeOther income

sequence.title: Sequence
sequence.description: "Rental income" and "Contract income" transactions must have a sequential numbering. The available sequences can be managed via the [numbering sequence](#operation/numberingsequence_contract-income_list) endpoints.

number.title: Number
number.description: "Rental income" and "Contract income"  transactions must have a sequential numbering. Elorus will manage numbering automatically, unless you want to explicitly assign numbers yourself.

contact_name.title: Contact name
contact_name.description: "Rental income" and "Contract income" transactions must by uploaded to the myDATA platform. This field represents the counterpart name, as it will be sent to myDATA.The field is effective only when the myDATA integration is enabled.

contact_vat_number.title: Contact tax ID
contact_vat_number.description: "Rental income" and "Contract income"  transactions must by uploaded to the myDATA platform. This field represents the counterpart tax ID, as it will be sent to myDATA.The field is effective only when the myDATA integration is enabled.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

net.title: Total value
net.description: Applies only to "Income" transactions and shows the de-taxed amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

vat_exemption_category.title: VAT exemption category
vat_exemption_category.description:
"Rental income" and "Contract income" transactions must by uploaded to the myDATA platform. This field is effective only when the myDATA integration is enabled. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
1Without VAT - article 2 & 3 of the VAT code
2Without VAT - article 5 of the VAT code
3Without VAT - article 13 of the VAT code
4Without VAT - article 14 of the VAT code
5Without VAT - article 16 of the VAT code
6Without VAT - article 19 of the VAT code
7Without VAT - article 22 of the VAT code
8Without VAT - article 24 of the VAT code
9Without VAT - article 25 of the VAT code
10Without VAT - article 26 of the VAT code
11Without VAT - article 27 of the VAT code

13Without VAT - article 27.1.g - Seagoing Vessels of the VAT code
14Without VAT - article 28 of the VAT code
15Without VAT - article 39 of the VAT code
16Without VAT - article 39a of the VAT code
17Without VAT - article 40 of the VAT code
18Without VAT - article 41 of the VAT code
19Without VAT - article 47 of the VAT code
20VAT included - article 43 of the VAT code
21VAT included - article 44 of the VAT code
22VAT included - article 45 of the VAT code
23VAT included - article 46 of the VAT code

31Excluding VAT -Article 47d of the VAT Code (IOSS)

invoice_payments.description: A list of the invoices paid via this transaction. Applies to "Client payment" transactions.

purchasecreditnote_payments.description: A list of the purchase credit notes paid via this transaction. Applies to "Supplier refund" transactions.

mydata_document_type.title: MyDATA document type
mydata_document_type.description:
"Rental income" and "Contract income" transactions must by uploaded to the myDATA platform. This field is generated automatically, based on the record's income type. One of the following or blank (empty string):
List of values
ValueDescription
7.1Contract - Income
8.1Rents - Income
8.2Special Record - Accommodation Tax Collection / Payment Receipt

mydata_uid.title: UID
mydata_uid.description: Unique identifier from myDATA.

mydata_latest_mark.title: Mydata latest mark
mydata_latest_mark.description: Unique submission ID from myDATA that indicates this document has been submitted.

mydata_latest_cancel_mark.title: Mydata latest cancel mark
mydata_latest_cancel_mark.description: If the latest submission has been canceled, this is the cancellation ID.

mydata_submission_status.title: Mydata submission status
mydata_submission_status.description:
Document status in relation to myDATA. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
sentsent
not_applicablenot_applicable
wont_sendwont_send
not_sentnot_sent

authentication_code.title: Authentication code
authentication_code.description: Hash that verifies that the document is valid.

payment_gateway.title: Payment Gateway
payment_gateway.description: ID of the payment gateway that was used to process the payment. Applies only to actual client payments made via Elorus.

trackingcategories.description: An optional list of tracking categories to classify this record.

created.title: Created on
created.description: Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: Timezone information is included.

transaction_type.title: Transaction type
transaction_type.description:
One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
dpOther payments
ipClient payment
cnpSupplier refund
icmIncome
atAccommodation tax

date.title: Date
date.description: Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

income_type.title: Income type
income_type.description:
Applies only to "Income" transactions. One of the following or blank (empty string):
List of values
ValueDescription
contractContract income
rentalRental income
other_incomeOther income

sequence.title: Sequence
sequence.description: "Rental income" and "Contract income" transactions must have a sequential numbering. The available sequences can be managed via the [numbering sequence](#operation/numberingsequence_contract-income_list) endpoints.

number.title: Number
number.description: "Rental income" and "Contract income"  transactions must have a sequential numbering. Elorus will manage numbering automatically, unless you want to explicitly assign numbers yourself.

contact_name.title: Contact name
contact_name.description: "Rental income" and "Contract income" transactions must by uploaded to the myDATA platform. This field represents the counterpart name, as it will be sent to myDATA.The field is effective only when the myDATA integration is enabled.

contact_vat_number.title: Contact tax ID
contact_vat_number.description: "Rental income" and "Contract income"  transactions must by uploaded to the myDATA platform. This field represents the counterpart tax ID, as it will be sent to myDATA.The field is effective only when the myDATA integration is enabled.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Applies only to "Income" transactions and dictates how amounts will be calculated if there exist associated taxes. One of the following or blank (empty string):
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

net.title: Total value
net.description: Applies only to "Income" transactions and shows the de-taxed amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of the applied tax IDs. Applies only to "Income" transactions.

items.title: Taxes
items.description: A list of the applied tax IDs. Applies only to "Income" transactions.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Applies only to "Income" transactions and dictates how amounts will be calculated if there exist associated taxes. One of the following or blank (empty string):
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

net.title: Total value
net.description: Applies only to "Income" transactions and shows the de-taxed amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of the applied tax IDs. Applies only to "Income" transactions.

items.title: Taxes
items.description: A list of the applied tax IDs. Applies only to "Income" transactions.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payment_method.title: Payment method
payment_method.description:
"Rental income" and "Contract income" transactions must by uploaded to the myDATA platform. This field represents the counterpart name, as it will be sent to myDATA.The field is effective only when the myDATA integration is enabled. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
1Domestic Payments Account
2Foreign Payments Account
3Cash
4Cheque
6Web Banking
7POS / e-POS

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

mydata_document_type.title: MyDATA document type
mydata_document_type.description:
Available only when myDATA integration is enabled. One of the following or blank (empty string):
List of values
ValueDescription
5.1Credit Invoice / Associated
5.2Credit Invoice / Non-Associated
11.4Retail Sales Credit Note

mydata_uid.title: UID
mydata_uid.description: Available only when myDATA integration is enabled.

mydata_latest_mark.title: Mydata latest mark
mydata_latest_mark.description: Unique submission ID from myDATA that indicates this document has been submitted.

mydata_latest_cancel_mark.title: Mydata latest cancel mark
mydata_latest_cancel_mark.description: If the latest submission has been canceled, this is the cancellation ID.

authentication_code.description: Hash that verifies that the document is valid.

modified.title: Modified on

product.description: ID of the associated product / service.

title.description: If not provided it will be retrieved from the related product.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 4 decimal places.

unit_value.title: Unit value
unit_value.description: Used in the "initial" calculation mode. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

unit_discount.title: Unit discount
unit_discount.description: Absolute value, not percentage. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 5 decimal places.

taxes.description: A list of the applied tax IDs.

exchange_rate.title: Exchange rate
exchange_rate.description: Comes into effect when the currency of the transaction is different than the base currency. Will always equal 1.00 for the base currency. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 6 decimal places.

calculator_mode.title: Value calculator mode
calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
initialTax exclusive
totalTax inclusive

initial.title: Initial value
initial.description: Total initial value, before any discount is applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

net.title: Net value
net.description: Total net value, before any taxes are applied. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

total.title: Total value
total.description: Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

withholding_taxes.description: A list of withholding tax IDs to be applied.

items.title: Withholding taxes
items.description: A list of withholding tax IDs to be applied.

paid.title: Paid
paid.description: Total paid amount. Automatically calculated amount. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total payable amount. Automatically calculated amount. This amount may differ from the total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

template.title: Template
template.description: ID of the associated template.

terms.title: Terms & conditions
terms.description: These terms are displayed on the document's printable form.

public_notes.title: Public notes
public_notes.description: These notes are displayed on the document's printable form.
public_notes.example: Notes visible on the credit note

paid_on_receipt.title: Paid on receipt
paid_on_receipt.description: Available only when myDATA integration is enabled. Decimal rendered as string, with the `.` character used as a floating point. Up to 2 decimal places.

payment_method.title: Payment method
payment_method.description:
Available only when myDATA integration is enabled. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
1Domestic Payments Account
2Foreign Payments Account
3Cash
4Cheque
6Web Banking
7POS / e-POS

vat_payment_suspension.title: Vat payment suspension
vat_payment_suspension.description: Available only when myDATA integration is enabled.

mydata_document_type.title: MyDATA document type
mydata_document_type.description:
Available only when myDATA integration is enabled. One of the following or blank (empty string):
List of values
ValueDescription
5.1Credit Invoice / Associated
5.2Credit Invoice / Non-Associated
11.4Retail Sales Credit Note

mydata_uid.title: UID
mydata_uid.description: Available only when myDATA integration is enabled.

mydata_latest_mark.title: Mydata latest mark
mydata_latest_mark.description: Unique submission ID from myDATA that indicates this document has been submitted.

mydata_latest_cancel_mark.title: Mydata latest cancel mark
mydata_latest_cancel_mark.description: If the latest submission has been canceled, this is the cancellation ID.

mydata_submission_status.title: Mydata submission status
mydata_submission_status.description:
Document status in relation to myDATA. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
sentsent
not_applicablenot_applicable
wont_sendwont_send
not_sentnot_sent

authentication_code.title: Authentication code
authentication_code.description: Hash that verifies that the document is valid.

related_documents.description: A list of invoice IDs linked to this credit document. This information is solely for display purposes, it will appear on the PDF

items.title: Related documents
items.description: A list of invoice IDs linked to this credit document. This information is solely for display purposes, it will appear on the PDF

trackingcategories.description: An optional list of tracking categories to classify this record.

created.title: Created on
created.description: ISO-formatted creation date & time. Timezone information is included.

modified.title: Modified on
modified.description: ISO-formatted last modification date & time. Timezone information is included.

status.title: Status
status.description:
Automatically generated status. One of the following:
List of values
ValueDescription
draftDraft
issuedIssued
partialPartially paid
paidPaid
voidVoid

draft.title: Draft
draft.description: If `true` the document is considered to be a work in progress.

documenttype.title: Document type
documenttype.description: ID of the associated document type.

sequence.title: Sequence
sequence.description: ID of the associated numbering sequence.

number.title: Number
number.description: Use empty string or do not send it at all, for automatic numbering.

date.title: Date
date.description: The issue date. Date is in the form of `YYYY-mm-dd`.

Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:

initialTax exclusive

initial.title: Initial value
